#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonized variable from the study-specific variables they has to be recoded as follows:

First of all: 

* `recode 2,3,4,5,6 into 2` 

Secondly, 

* `if any of the variables is equal to 2 recode proxy = 1`
* `otherwise proxy = 0`


**R script:**

```{r harmo_aksst1, echo=TRUE}
JSTAR_proxy$a_022 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$a_022, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$b_018 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$b_018, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$c_130 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$c_130, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$f_006 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$f_006, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$g_030 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$g_030, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$i_003 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$i_003, "2:6=2")

JSTAR_proxy$have2 <- apply(JSTAR_proxy[,-1], MARGIN = 1, FUN = function(x) sum(x==2, na.rm = TRUE)>=1)
JSTAR_proxy$nmis <- apply(JSTAR_proxy[,-1], MARGIN = 1, FUN = function(x) sum(is.na(x)))



JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=JSTAR_proxy$id)
JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1$proxy <- 0
JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1$proxy[JSTAR_proxy$have2] <- 1
JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1$proxy[JSTAR_proxy$nmis==6] <- 999
JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1$proxy <- labelled(JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1$proxy, labels = cat_label)
label(JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1$proxy) <- ds_label_all
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_aksst1, echo=FALSE}
vari <- JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1$proxy
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = ds_label) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(proxy))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")
```


```{r importOPAL_aksst1, echo=FALSE}
proxy <- JSTAR_aksst_ds_w1
save(proxy, file = "../RData/aksst_w1/proxy.RData")
rm(proxy, JSTAR_proxy)
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonized variable from the study-specific variables they has to be recoded as follows:

First of all: 

* `recode 2,3,4,5,6 into 2` 

Secondly, 

* `if any of the variables is equal to 2 recode proxy = 1`
* `otherwise proxy = 0`


**R script:**

```{r harmo_aksst3, echo=TRUE}
JSTAR_proxy$a_022 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$a_022, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$b_019 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$b_019, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$c_100a <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$c_100a, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$c_200 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$c_200, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$d_016 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$d_016, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$d_022 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$d_022, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$e_053 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$e_053, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$f_010 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$f_010, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$g_037 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$g_037, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$h_040 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$h_040, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$i_003 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$i_003, "2:6=2")

JSTAR_proxy$have2 <- apply(JSTAR_proxy[,-1], MARGIN = 1, FUN = function(x) sum(x==2, na.rm = TRUE)>=1)
JSTAR_proxy$nmis <- apply(JSTAR_proxy[,-1], MARGIN = 1, FUN = function(x) sum(is.na(x)))

JSTAR_aksst_ds_w3 <- tibble(id=JSTAR_proxy$id)
JSTAR_aksst_ds_w3$proxy <- 0
JSTAR_aksst_ds_w3$proxy[JSTAR_proxy$have2] <- 1
JSTAR_aksst_ds_w3$proxy[JSTAR_proxy$nmis==11] <- 999
JSTAR_aksst_ds_w3$proxy <- labelled(JSTAR_aksst_ds_w3$proxy, labels = cat_label)
label(JSTAR_aksst_ds_w3$proxy) <- ds_label_all
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_aksst3, echo=FALSE}

kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = ds_label) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonized variable from the study-specific variables they has to be recoded as follows:

First of all: 

* `recode 2,3,4,5,6 into 2` 

Secondly, 

* `if any of the variables is equal to 2 recode proxy = 1`
* `otherwise proxy = 0`


**R script:**

```{r harmo_cth1, echo=TRUE}
JSTAR_proxy$a_022 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$a_022, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$b_018 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$b_018, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$d_018 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$d_018, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$e_053 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$e_053, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$f_006 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$f_006, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$g_030 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$g_030, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$h_056 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$h_056, "2:6=2")
JSTAR_proxy$i_003 <- car::recode(JSTAR_proxy$i_003, "2:6=2")

JSTAR_proxy$have2 <- apply(JSTAR_proxy[,-1], MARGIN = 1, FUN = function(x) sum(x==2, na.rm = TRUE)>=1)
JSTAR_proxy$nmis <- apply(JSTAR_proxy[,-1], MARGIN = 1, FUN = function(x) sum(is.na(x)))

JSTAR_cth_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=JSTAR_proxy$id)
JSTAR_cth_ds_w1$proxy <- 0
JSTAR_cth_ds_w1$proxy[JSTAR_proxy$have2] <- 1
JSTAR_cth_ds_w1$proxy[JSTAR_proxy$nmis==8] <- 999
JSTAR_cth_ds_w1$proxy <- labelled(JSTAR_cth_ds_w1$proxy, labels = cat_label)
label(JSTAR_cth_ds_w1$proxy) <- ds_label_all
```
